intro: Pleurothallis liparanges, commonly known as the "Liparange Orchid," is a species native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and delicate, often fragrant flowers. The plant typically produces small, greenish-white to pale yellow blooms that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining, acidic soil for optimal growth. Due to its unique appearance and relatively low maintenance, it is a popular choice for orchid enthusiasts.
